thread.title: "Latest weather forecasts worrying": Meteorologists expect more rain in flood regions - The Limited Times
thread.title_full: "Latest weather forecasts worrying": Meteorologists expect more rain in flood regions - The Limited Times

author: Anonym
title: "Latest weather forecasts worrying": Meteorologists expect more rain in flood regions - The Limited Times
text:
Status: 29.12.2023, 18:46 PM
By: Bjarne Kommnick
CommentsPrint Share
Many regions of Germany are currently struggling against floods caused by storm "Zoltan". There is no improvement in sight, on the contrary: new rain is on the way.
Munich – The flood situation in Germany remains critical. In the past few days, experts were already expecting further rain at the turn of the year. This forecast now seems to be confirmed: In the flood areas, of all places, heavy downpours are expected to occur again at the turn of the year.
"Weather forecasts worrying": Despite flooding, no end to rain in sight for the time being Meteorologist Dominik Jung from wetter.net explains in a press release: "The latest weather forecasts are worrying." In the next 48 hours, the "high-resolution ICON-D2 model" from the German Weather Service (DWD) would expect 30 to 50 liters of precipitation per square meter, especially in the flood areas.
Will the situation in the flood areas come to a head at the turn of the year? According to the weather forecast, it probably is. Meteorologists announce new rain. (symbolic photo) © Sebastian Kahnert/dpa
Although water levels are currently falling again in many places, the outlook for the weather in the coming days could further exacerbate the situation. Especially over central Germany, where many dams are currently overflowing, the experts expect heavy precipitation until the end of the year.
And the experts also predict new masses of water in Germany in January: "The first ten days of January could bring 100 to 120 litres of rain in the west and south. The westerly weather situation simply does not want to end in the serious forecast period," says Jung. According to information from the DWD, the westerly weather situation (also known as "westerly exposure") describes a weather situation in which a strong west-to-east current develops over Europe over several days.
Weather in Germany: "Cold and snow don't stand a chance for the time being" Winter fans will probably go away empty-handed at the beginning of the year. "Cold and snow don't stand a chance in Germany for the time being. As a result, the risk of flooding remains very tense," predicts Jung. "In many cases, the dikes and dams are softening more and more, threatening to break. They are soaked by the rain and pressurized by the floods."
My news Thief fills 189 liters in canister reading
Discharged water from reservoir threatens places in Thuringia
The oldest butcher's shop in Germany comes from Baden-Württemberg read

Overall, it was particularly wet in 2023. According to a press release from the German Weather Service, this year was the sixth wettest year on record. At around 958 litres per square metre, more than 20 per cent more precipitation fell than in the reference period 1961 to 1990 (789 l/m²). November even turned out to be the second wettest since 1881.
